best_practices: Always exclude build directories (node_modules, dist, build) from searches
Use file type filters to reduce noise and improve performance
Start with broad searches and progressively add filters
Save frequently used search patterns for team consistency
anti_patterns: Searching entire codebase without filters on large projects
Using case-sensitive searches when case doesn't matter
Ignoring .gitignore patterns and including generated files
Not showing context around matches (-C flag with grep/rg)

faq.question: Which search tool should I use?
faq.answer: Ripgrep (rg) is recommended for speed and automatic .gitignore respect. Use grep for basic searches or when rg isn't available.

faq.question: How do I search for multi-line patterns?
faq.answer: Use ripgrep with -U flag for multi-line regex: rg -U 'interface.*\{[^}]*\}' -t ts

faq.question: Can this skill search in my specific language?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports all languages with examples for JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, and more.

faq.question: How do I exclude test files from results?
faq.answer: Use --glob flag: rg 'pattern' --glob '!**/*.test.*' or exclude directories: rg 'pattern' --exclude-dir=tests

faq.question: What's the difference between text and semantic search?
faq.answer: Text search matches exact keywords. Semantic search understands code structure like function definitions, imports, and class hierarchies.

faq.question: How can I search for similar code patterns?
faq.answer: Use regex patterns with alternation: rg '(function|const|class) \w+' or combine searches with pipes: rg 'async' | rg 'await'
